title: Past Continuous
description: The past continuous is used to talk about actions that were happening at a specific time in the past. It often describes background actions.

subtopics.title: Affirmative Sentences
subtopics.description: Use 'was/were' + verb-ing to say what was happening in the past.

subtopics.title: Negative Sentences
subtopics.description: Use 'was not/weren't' + verb-ing to say something was not happening.

subtopics.title: Questions
subtopics.description: Put 'was/were' before the subject to ask about actions in the past.

subtopics.title: Past Continuous with Past Simple
subtopics.description: Use the past continuous for a longer action and the past simple for a short action that happened during it.

examples.sample: She was cooking when I arrived.
They were playing football when it started to rain.
I was reading when the phone rang.

exercises.question: How do you ask about an action in the past?

exercises.instruction: Rewrite as a question: 'He was playing football.'
